children.name: Introduction
Optimize your Payment Term Usage

blocks.text: This dashboard provides transparency on how you can optimize your payment terms to positively impact you financial performance, specifically improving your working capital by increasing Days Sales Outstanding and avoiding manual effort.

A payment term is  an agreement between seller and buyer specifying when the invoice amount is due and whether cash discount is provided. Payment terms are used on different level of SAP data - typically they are set in the customer master data and derived from the customer master data when a sales document is created. Typically, the payment term is then copied into the follow-on documents, more specifically the customer invoice and the financial document.

The payment terms used do not only have a big impact on the cash conversion cycle, but are also a sensitive value which should be typically derived and consistently used based on customer master data. That's why this analysis does not only include information on unfavorable and immediate payment terms but also on changes and deviations in payment terms occurring along the invoice to cash process.
The following dashboard is structured as follows:
General Overview: Get an overview on your payment term usage and learn in which areas improvement potential has been identified
Avoid unfavorable payment terms: Understand to which extent you are using unfavorable payment terms and assess their financial impact

Avoid changes in payment terms: Analyzing changes in payment terms between billing document and financial document, especially those towards less favorable payment term, are an indicator for either master data issues or customer changing the initially agreed conditions. Identifying the impact of these changes as well as the affected suppliers support you in improving the consistency in payment terms
Details: In case you would like to drill down to single document level, you may use this view to get further details for each invoice document
Timeframe

The invoices included in this analysis are selected based on their document date.  Please be aware that only completed cases included in this dashboard, i.e. cases that have been cleared (Last Inv. Item Document Number of the Clearing Document field is not null).

children.name: MIN Case Creation Date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MIN("Inv. Date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: MAX Case Creation Date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MAX("Inv. Date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: 01. General Overview
Number of Cases
children.description: Total number of invoices that have been created within the reference period

children.name: Financial Impact of Unfavorable Payment Term Usage
children.description: Total financial impact of unfavorable payment term usage assuming 4% of interest in case the amount would have been invested

dataSource.query:
SELECT  SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" >  DURATION '14days'))
     	    * DURATION_TO_DAYS((AVG("Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date") - DURATION '14days'))
	    * 0.04 / 365 AS "Financial impact"
	FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Total Invoice Amount
children.description: Gross invoice amount for all invoices

children.name: General Overview

blocks.text: The following section provide an overview on the payment term usage along your invoice to cash process. It helps you to assess to which extent you can improve your payment term usage and which aspects you might want to focus on.

Use the overview section to understand how many cases and which invoice amount is included in the analysis, followed by metrics uncovering improvement potential including financial impact of unfavorable payment term usage.

children.name: Number of Unique Payment Terms Used
children.description: Number of payment terms used across all data, regardless of clients and systems

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT(DISTINCT "Inv. Client"||"Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Costs of Manual Payment Term Changes
children.description: Assumption: 10min for manual changes, 25 EUR average hourly rate of an employee

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)
	   FILTER (
       WHERE "event_name" MATCHES ('Change Payment Term')
       ) * (25/6) AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG time: Clearing Posting and Clearing Entry in the Future
children.description: Average time between clearing date and clearing entry date with clearing date in the future

dataSource.query:
SELECT AVG ( "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date") 
	FILTER
    (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" > "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date")
	AS "AVG clearing time"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG time: Clearing Posting and Clearing Entry in the Past

dataSource.query:
SELECT AVG ( "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date" - "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date") 
   	   FILTER
	  (WHERE "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" < "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date")
AS "AVG clearing time"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Identify Improvement Potential

blocks.text: The  below metrics help you to decide which aspect to focus on when it comes to optimizing your payment terms:

Financial impact of unfavorable payment term usage: Receiving your customer payments late due to unfavorable payment terms increases your Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) and thus negatively impacts your working capital. In case of a significant financial impact of unfavorable payment terms, you might want to dive deeper into the issue using the analyses included in the section 'Avoid Unfavorable Payment Terms'

Changes in payment terms cause manual effort and can impact  your DSO if changes are performed leading to unfavorable payment terms. Using the analyses for 'Avoid Changes in Payment Terms' you can identify which organizational units perform these changes frequently and which customers are mostly affected
Differences between clearing date and clearing entry date can lead to reporting discrepancies, ageing analysis inaccuracies, cashflow forecasting issues and can hint at compliance issues

children.name: Overview of the Top 10 Payment Terms Used

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	 "Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key",
      COUNT(case_id) AS "# Cases",
	"Last Inv. Item Account Type",
     "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1",
     "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1",
     "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 2",
     "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2",
     "Last Inv. Item Net Payment Terms Period"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Understand which Payment Terms are Most Frequently Used

blocks.text: Beyond the number of payment terms used, the following section shows the ten most frequently used payment terms. Based on that, you can start assessing to what extent these payment terms are considered favorable for your company.

children.name: 02. Avoid Unfavorable Payment Terms
Financial Impact of Unfavorable Payment Term Usage
children.description: Total financial impact of unfavorable payment term usage assuming 4% of interest in case the amount would have been invested

dataSource.query:
SELECT  SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" >  DURATION '14days'))
     	    * DURATION_TO_DAYS((AVG("Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date") - DURATION '14days'))
	    * 0.04 / 365 AS "Financial impact"
	FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Total Invoice Amount
children.description: Gross invoice amount for all invoices

children.name: Avoid Unfavorable Payment Terms

blocks.text: The following section provide an overview on the payment term usage along your invoice to cash process. The analysis differentiates between unfavorable payment terms and favorable payment terms. Please be aware that for this analysis, the actual payment terms valid at the time of the clearing are considered.

In order to show to what extent payment terms affect your financial situation, it also includes the financial impact of unfavorable payment term usage. The impact is calculated based on the interest you could have earned if you had received the customer payment earlier in case you had negotiated favorable payment terms with your customers.

children.name: Understanding Types of Payment Terms and their Impact

blocks.text: The analysis on the right provides an overview on your payment term usage across over time.
It differentiates between:
Unfavorable payment terms - payment within more than two weeks
Favorable payment terms - payment within less than two weeks

Unfavorable payment terms should also be avoided to improve working capital. If unfavorable payment terms are applied to a significant part of your invoice value, it is recommended to reconsider the payment terms used and define follow-up actions to improve the situation.

children.name: Payment Terms used based on Invoice Amount Over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('month', "Inv. Accounting Document Date") AS "Accounting document entry date",
    CASE 
    WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" > DURATION '14days'
    THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
	END AS "Payment terms category",
    SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice value"
    
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Type of Payment Terms Used by Top 10 Company Codes by Invoice Value
children.description: Showing whether immediate/unfavorable/favorable payment terms are used for the 10 company codes with the biggest invoice value

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount",
        "Company Code", 
		"Payment terms category"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Payment terms category", 
         "Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount", 
              CASE 
    			WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" > DURATION '14days'
    			THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    			ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
				END AS "Payment terms category", 
            "Inv. Company Code" ||' - '||"Inv. Company Code Text" AS "Company Code",
         	SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Inv. Company Code") as "sum"
         FROM
       THIS_PROCESS) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST

children.name: Type of Payment Terms Used by Top 10 Customers by Invoice Value
children.description: Showing whether immediate/unfavorable/favorable payment terms are used for the 10 customers with the biggest invoice value

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount", 
 		"Customer",
		"Payment terms category"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Payment terms category", 
         "Customer",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice amount", 
             CASE 
    			WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" > DURATION '14days'
    			THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    			ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
			END AS "Payment terms category", 
         "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer",
         SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Last Inv. Item Customer Number") as "sum"
         FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST

children.name: Prioritizing Company Codes and Customers for Payment Term Optimization

blocks.text: Analyzing payment terms by company code enables you to understand which organizational units use which kind of payment terms most frequently. This can be helpful for prioritizing company codes which need to optimize their payment term usage, for example.

Since payment terms typically depend on the customer you buy from, an additional overview is provided to show which kind of payment terms are used for those ten customers with which you do most business with in terms of invoice value. If unfavorable payment terms are used for these customers, you might want to consider renegotiating the payment terms with these customers.

children.name: 03. Avoid Changes in Payment Terms
Assess Payment Terms Changes in Invoice-to-Cash

blocks.text: Compared to other changes, changes to payment terms within the documents created along the invoice to cash process can have a big impact on your financial performance. Whereas changes generally mean additional manual effort, payment term changes directly impact your working capital and can also hint at customer master data or compliance issues, in case changes are performed frequently for the same customers. Using the following analyses, you can evaluate whether payment term changes are happening frequently along your invoice to cash process flow and whether they have a negative impact on your working capital. Additionally, they provide guidance where and how you could start working on the issue.
Please consider that changes for supplier invoices and financial documents performed by dialog users are considered in the following analyses.

children.name: Percentage of Cases with Payment Term Changes
children.description: Percentage of cases with payment term changes either in supplier invoice or FI-AP document. Number is compared to the total number of cases

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT (DISTINCT CASE_ID)/ COUNT(DISTINCT CASE_ID) * 100 AS "Percentage"
    FROM 
		(SELECT case_id
    	FROM FLATTEN (THIS_PROCESS)
    	WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
		) as SUB

children.name: Number of Cases with Payment Term Changes
children.description: Number of cases with payment term changes either in  invoice or FI-AP document. Number is compared to the total number of cases

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT (DISTINCT CASE_ID) 
FROM (SELECT
			CASE_ID
      FROM FLATTEN (THIS_PROCESS)
      WHERE 
          "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
      ) AS SUB

children.name: Costs of Manual Payment Term Changes
children.description: Assumption: 10min for manual changes, 25 EUR average hourly rate of an employee

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)
	   FILTER (
       WHERE "event_name" MATCHES ('Change Payment Term')
       ) * (25/6) AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Top 10 Cases with Payment Term Changes by Company Code and Invoice Value Affected
children.description: Cases with changes in payment terms for the top 10 company codes by invoice value affected

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Percentage", 
 		"Inv. Company Code"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Percentage", 
         "Inv. Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT 
            SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                ) 
            AS "Affected amount", 
        	COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                ) 
	        / COUNT(case_id) * 100 
            AS "Percentage", 
         	"Inv. Company Code",
         	SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                )
	        ) OVER (PARTITION BY "Inv. Company Code") as "sum"
            FROM 
            (SELECT case_id,
                    "Inv. Converted USD Amount",
                    "event_name",
                    "Inv. Company Code"					
                FROM FLATTEN (THIS_PROCESS)
                ) AS SUB
            ) AS SUB
        ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 Cases with Payment Term Changes by Customer and Invoice Value Affected
children.description: Cases with changes in payment terms for the top 10 customers by invoice value affected

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Percentage", 
 		"Last Inv. Item Customer Number"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Percentage", 
         "Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT 
            SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount") FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                ) 
            AS "Affected amount", 
        	COUNT(case_id) FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                ) 
	        / COUNT(case_id) * 100 
            AS "Percentage", 
         	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
         	SUM (SUM("Inv. Converted USD Amount")FILTER (
                WHERE "event_name" = 'Change Payment Term'
                )
	        ) OVER (PARTITION BY "Last Inv. Item Customer Number") as "sum"
            FROM 
            (SELECT 
					case_id,
                    "Inv. Converted USD Amount",
                    "event_name",
                    "Last Inv. Item Customer Number"
                FROM FLATTEN (THIS_PROCESS)
                ) AS SUB
            ) AS SUB
        ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
NULLS LAST
LIMIT 10

children.name: Impact of Changed Payment Terms

dataSource.query:
SELECT	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number" ,
		"Changed Table", 
		"Impact",
	   	"Cases affected",
	  	"Amount affected"
FROM (SELECT 
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "Cases affected",
	FIRST("Inv. Converted USD Amount" ) AS "Amount affected",
	CASE WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") < TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '✅' 
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") = TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '⚠' 
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") > TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '⛔' 
	 END AS "Impact",
	 "Last Inv. Item Customer Number", 
     "Changed Table"
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
	WHERE "event_name" LIKE 'Change Payment Days%'
	AND "Changed Field"	IN ('ZBD1T','ZBD2T','ZBD3T')
    ) as sub
ORDER BY 5 DESC

children.name: Evaluate the Dimension of the Issue

blocks.text: This first section helps you to understand how frequently changes to payment terms are happening and whether they are not only causing manual effort are also resulting in less favorable payment terms. Depending on this, you can decide whether you would like to analyze your payment term changes in further detail.

children.name: Prioritizing Company Codes and Customers to Avoid Payment Changes

blocks.text: Analyzing the breakdown by company code enables you to understand in which organizational units changes to payment terms are a big issue. This can be helpful for prioritizing which company codes need special attention when it comes to avoiding such changes moving forward.

Since payment terms relate to the customer you sell to and should be derived from customer master data, an additional overview is provided to show payment term changes for the ten customers with which you do most business with in terms of invoice value. You might want to consider checking the customer master data, specifically the payment terms and verify whether they are filled and whether they are up to date according to what has been agreed with the customer.

children.name: Avoid Unfavorable Payment Term Changes

blocks.text: Changing payment terms from favorable to unfavorable payment terms is not desirable from a financial point of view. In order to improve your working capital, such changes should be avoided. The analysis provides transparency on the customers affected by changes by invoice value and also shows whether the change has been unfavorable from your point of view.

Whereas all types of changes should be avoided, you might want to prioritize those customers where unfavorable changes are performed. For those , you might want to check which of the payment terms entered is the right payment term negotiated with the customer. And if it is an unfavorable payment term, you might want to renegotiate it.

children.name: Invoice Value of Cases with Unfavorable Payment Term Changes
children.description: Invoice value of cases with unfavorable payment term changes to longer terms either in  invoice or FI-AP document.

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM("Amount converted")
FROM
(
SELECT
	case_id,
    FIRST("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Amount converted",
	CASE WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") < TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '✅-↗️' 
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") = TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '✅-➡️' 
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") > TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '⛔-↘️' 
      END AS "Change behaviour"
    FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
	WHERE  "event_name" LIKE 'Change Payment Days%'
	    AND "Changed Field"	IN ('ZBD1T','ZBD2T','ZBD3T')
) as sub
WHERE "Change behaviour" = '⛔-↘️'

children.name: Unfavorable Payment Term Changes Over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT	"Change date",
	   	"Cases affected",
	  	"Amount affected"
FROM (SELECT 
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "Cases affected",
	FIRST("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Amount affected",
	CASE WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") < TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '✅-↗️'
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") = TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '✅-➡️' 
      WHEN TO_NUMBER("Change Old Value") > TO_NUMBER("Change New Value") THEN '⛔-↘️'  
	 END AS "Change behaviour",
	DATE_TRUNC('month', end_time) AS "Change date"
    
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
	WHERE "event_name" LIKE 'Change Payment Days%'
	AND "Changed field"	IN ('ZBD1T','ZBD2T','ZBD3T')
) as sub
WHERE "Change behaviour" = '⛔-↘️'
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: 04. Details
BD immediate payment terms: master data set up

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	 "BD payment terms",
      COUNT(case_id) AS "# cases",
	 "BD payment term description",
     "BD payment term account type",
     "BD payment term date type",
     "BD payment term date type text",
     "BD payment term calendar day for the baseline date for payment",
     "BD payment term additional months",
     "BD payment term cash discount days 1",
     "BD payment term cash discount percentage 1",
     "BD payment term due date for special condition",
     "BD payment term additional months for special condition (term 1)",
     "BD payment term cash discount days 2",
     "BD payment term cash discount percentage 2",
     "BD payment term Net payment terms period",
     "BD payment term for installment payment"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "BD payment terms" IS NOT NULL
	  AND ("BD payment term cash discount days 1" = 0 
	  OR "BD payment term cash discount days 1" IS NULL)
ORDER BY 2 DESC

children.name: Payment Term Usage by Cases

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	 case_id,
    "Last Inv. Item Billing Document",
    "Inv. Accounting Document Number",
    "Inv. Fiscal Year",
    "Inv. Company Code", 
    "Inv. Fiscal Year", 
    "Inv. Converted USD Amount",
    "Inv. Converted USD Cash Discount Amount",
    "Inv. Accounting Document Date" ,
	"SD organization",
	"Last Inv. Item Customer Number",
	"Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key",
	CASE 
    	WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" = 0 OR "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1" IS NULL
    	THEN 'Immediate payment terms'
    	WHEN "Last Inv. Item Due Date" - "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date" > DURATION '15days'
    	THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    	ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
     END AS "Payment terms category",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 1",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Days 2",
    "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2",
    "Last Inv. Item Net Payment Terms Period"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
